SearchLevelType.description:
Search level identifying which transactions should
				be returned. If not specified, defaulted to 0.
				Supported values are:

				0 - Search for entries on the account specified only or the card
				specified only
				1 - Search for entries on the default account linked
				to the card
				specified not only on the
				specified card. Applicable only
				when the account is not specified
				2 - Search for entries on all
				accounts linked to the card specified.
				Applicable only when
				the
				account is not specified

status.description:
List of card statuses required in the response.If multiple values are required, these should be separated by -

							The current supported cortex card statuses are the below

							Value
							Description
							00 NORMAL
							01 PIN TRIES EXCEEDED
							02 NOT YET ISSUED
							03 CARD
							EXPIRED
							04 LOST (equivalent to block code L)
							05 STOLEN (equivalent
							to block code S)
							06 CUSTOMER CLOSE (equivalent to block code C)
							07
							BANK CANCELED
							08 FRAUD (equivalent to block code O)
							09 DAMAGED
							(equivalent to block code G)
							20 PENDING ISSUANCE (printing)
							21 CARD
							EXTRACTED (embossing file generated for bulk issuance)
							22
							EXTRACTION FAILED (embossing file generation failed for bulk
							issuance)
							23 FAILED AT BUREAU (bulk issuance printing failed)
							24
							PRINTING FAILED
							30 PENDING ACTIVATION
							40 AGGREEMENT (equivalent to
							block code E)
							42 CLOSED BY NCB (equivalent to block code K)
							44
							FRAUD CUSTOMER REQUESTED (equivalent to block code P)
							45 CUSTOMER
							DEAD (equivalent to block code D)
							46 CHANGE PRODUCT (equivalent to
							block code X)
							48 NOT RENEWED (equivalent to block code N)
							49 SAMA
							BLOCKED (equivalent to block code J)
							50 RISK STOPPED (equivalent
							to block code Q)
							51 FRAUD APPLICANT (equivalent to block code F)
							52 INACTIVE (equivalent to block code I)
							53 COURT JUDGEMENT
							54
							Expired ID (equivalent to block code M)
							55 RETURNED CARD
							(equivalent to block code R)
							56 CUSTOMER CANCELED (equivalent to
							block code T)
							57 TEMP BLOCK (equivalent to block code U)
							86 PILOT
							BLOCK
							98 PURGE (equivalent to block code P)
							99 COLLECTION

						transaction. Only valid in

transactionStatus.description:
Identifies the status of the
						transaction. A
						predefined
						list of values exists of
						which the below indicate
						that the
						transaction is not
						suspended (posted or
						eligible to be posted): - 0
						- not suspended - 101 -
						force posted

						To get the list of supported
						values and descriptions,
						please use the
						GetNumericDescription
						service with description
						type as "ccsist"

messageClass.description:
Identifies if the
						transaction is an

						Authorization Transaction -
						2: Financial Transaction -
						3: File
						Update - 4: Reversal
						- 5: Reconciliation - 6:
						Reconciliation - 7:
						Fee - 8:
						Network Management

functionCode.description:
Function code identifying
						the function of the
						transaction providing

						message class (i.e.
						original
						authorization, repeat,
						address validation...). To
						get the
						list of supported
						values, please use the
						GetNumericDescription
						service with description
						type 'fncode'

pan.description:
Encrypted card number the

						Not

Merchant category code of

						supported
						values, please use the
						GetNumericDescription
						service with
						description
						type as 'ab'

cardAcceptorId.description: Card acceptor id of the transaction

acquirerCountry.description:
Acquirer country code the
						transaction took
						location in

posted.description:
Specifies if the transaction
						is posted or still
						pending
						to be posted

systemTraceAuditNumber.description:
System Trace Audit Number in
						case available

retreivalReferenceNumber.description:
Retrieval reference number
						identifying the
						transaction

itemType.description:
Specifies the type of the
						item/transaction. A
						predefined list of values
						exists and custom items
						might be created.

						The pre-defined list of
						supported values is the
						following: 1-
						Transaction 2-
						Card-related fee 3-
						Card-related commission 4-
						Interest 5- Payment 6- Late
						payment penalty 7- Over
						limit penalty 8-
						Credit
						adjustment 9- Debit
						adjustment 10-
						Account-related fee 11-
						Payment plan credit
						adjustment. Used to mark the
						movement of an item
						to a
						payment plan when the plan
						is initialized 12- Payment
						plan debit
						adjustment. The
						corresponding debit to the
						item type 11 13- Due
						installment (Interest) 14-
						Due installment (principle)
						15- Due
						installment credit
						adjustment. This is the
						matching credit to item
						type
						14. 16- Credit for a
						cancelled payment plan. This
						is a credit
						to the not due
						installment balance to mark
						the cancellation of a
						payment plan. 17- Debit for
						a cancelled payment plan.
						This is a
						debit to a
						standard balance component
						of the account to mark the
						cancellation of a payment
						plan. This is the matching
						debit to item
						type 16

						20 - Targeted payment

						To get the full list of item
						types
						along with their
						description, please use the
						GetNumericDescription
						service with the description
						type as 'ccsity'

terminalCode.description:
Terminal code of the transaction. Only available
						in case the transaction was done using a terminal

applicationRule.description:
Specifies if the transaction
						was applied on the
						due
						balance or not due balance.
						Supported values: - 0 - All
						- N/A.
						Applied on both due
						and not due side. - 1 - Not
						Due Side - 2 - Due
						Side

paymentPlanOptions.description:
Single entry for the available payment plan
						options

name.description:
Name of the payment plan. This should be used in
						the NewPaymentPlanService to create a payment plan

description.description: Description of the payment plan option

allOf.description: Basis of interest rate

interestRate.description:
Interest rate % on the amount of the payment
						plan. It determines the interest added to the payment plan amount.
						For example, if the amount of the transaction is 1000 and the rate
						is 5%, the interest amount will be 50 and the total amount of the
						plan will become 10050. If a fixed rate is specified, it will also
						be added to the total amount of the plan. The percentage is always
						calculated on the transaction amount

allOf.description:
Fixed interest amount on the payment plan. It
						determines the fixed interest amount added to the payment plan
						amount.

						For example, if the amount of the transaction is 1000 and
						the fixed
						amount is 10, the total amount of the plan will become
						1010. If an
						interest rate % is also configured, it will also be
						added to the
						total amount of the plan.

expectedEndDate.description:
Expected end date for the payment plan assuming
						it's created in the
						current system date and this option is selected
						to convert the
						transaction to payment plan

allOf.description:
Single installment amount to be paid each month
						in case this option is selected to convert the transaction to
						payment plan

Last installment amount to be paid the last

						validate this field. It is used for logging purposes only

Status to set for the application. A back-end
						configuration exists to specify which status transitions are
						allowed. i.e if an application is declined, it should not be
						allowed to set it back to pending approval/pending decline...

processControl.description:
New Process control to set for the application.
						It can be used/updated to change the flow the application goes
						through during the processing. To get the list of supported
						process controls, use the GetProcessControlList service

processStage.description:
New process stage defined under the process
						control to start with. This can be used to skip specific
						processing if not required for an application or restart the
						processing from a specific stage. To get a list of supported
						processing stages, use the GetProcessControlList service with
						ReturnProcessStages flag set to true

processStageStatus.description:
Status of the processing stage. Can be used in
						case an external system did the processing for a specific stage
						and cortex needs to be updated with the result or to specify that
						the current or specified process stage should be repeated.
						Supported values are:
						- S: Process stage successful. Specifies that
						the process stage was
						completed successfully and cortex needs to
						continue processing
						from the next processing stage in case defined
						in the process
						control
						- F: Process stage failed. Specifies that the
						process stage was
						completed with failure and cortex only needs to
						log the
						application
						- R: Process stage needs to be repeated. Cortex
						will attempt to
						repeat the specified process stage and continue the
						flow in case
						defined

externalScore.description:

						needs to be logged by cortex. This value is not overwritten even
						if cortex is configured to do the scoring. The value can be used
						in the rule engine for other purposes

						assigned for the card. It can be used by the rule engine for limit

The sequence number can be skipped and will be defaulted to 0. The card expiry date can be used to identify which card plastic is required. In case not specified, the latest card with the specified PAN or VPAN will be taken into consideration.

ccsAccountIdentifier.description: Whenever a service does an update/action on an account and requires the account to be specified, the account identifier is used.

description.description: description

Specifies that the transactions should
						be ordered

						(oldest to newest). Should be skipped in
						case date local desc is specified

Specifies that the transactions should
						be ordered

fromAccountCurrency.description:
Currency of the account to transfer the amount
							from. The transfer amount should be expressed
							in this currency.
							The card should have an
							account with this currency linked to it
							otherwise the request is rejected. If multiple
							accounts with this
							currency are linked to the
							card (which should never be the case
							for
							multi-currency accounts), the request is also
							rejected

toAccountCurrency.description:
Currency of the account to transfer the amount
							to. The transfer amount should be expressed in
							this currency. The
							card should have an account
							with this currency linked to it
							otherwise the
							request is rejected. If multiple accounts with
							this
							currency are linked ot the card (which
							should never be the case
							for multi-currency
							accounts), the request is also rejected

allOf.description: Transfer amount expressed in the from currency

itemSource.description:
Source system the transaction was received
							from. If specified, the ItemReferenceCode
							should also be
							specified. If both are
							specified, Cortex will validate for
							duplicate
							transactions using the source and reference
							code

itemReferenceCode.description:
Reference number for the transaction from the
							source system. This should be an ever unique
							number from the
							source system. In case already
							existing with the same ItemSource,
							the request
							will be rejected. Mandatory in case the
							ItemSource is
							specified

checkAvailableBalance.description:
Specifies if available balance should be
							checked for the account in case of debit items.
							If set to true and
							the account does not have
							enough balance (including authorized
							amount),
							the request is rejected. Defaulted to false if
							not
							specified

Effective open to buy for the account
						including
						the authorization/blocked amount. This is mainly
						calculated using
						the formula (credit limit) - (balance) +
						(surplus) - (authorized
						amount)

						credit
						limit. This amount DOES NOT include any pending
						authorization
						amount (or blocked amount). Any debit on the
						account will use the
						amount from the surplus if available
						otherwise the balance is
						updated

itemType.description:
Specifies the type of the
						item/transaction. A
						predefined list of values
						exists and custom items
						might be created.

						The pre-defined list of
						supported values is the
						following: 1-
						Transaction 2-
						Card-related fee 3-
						Card-related commission 4-
						Interest 5- Payment 6- Late
						payment penalty 7- Over
						limit penalty 8-
						Credit
						adjustment 9- Debit
						adjustment 10-
						Account-related fee 11-
						Payment plan credit
						adjustment. Used to mark the
						movement of an item
						to a
						payment plan when the plan
						is initialized 12- Payment
						plan debit
						adjustment. The
						corresponding debit to the
						item type 11 13- Due
						installment (Interest) 14-
						Due installment (principle)
						15- Due
						installment credit
						adjustment. This is the
						matching credit to item
						type
						14. 16- Credit for a
						cancelled payment plan. This
						is a credit
						to the not due
						installment balance to mark
						the cancellation of a
						payment plan. 17- Debit for
						a cancelled payment plan.
						This is a
						debit to a
						standard balance component
						of the account to mark the
						cancellation of a payment
						plan. This is the matching
						debit to item
						type 16

						20 - Targeted payment

						To get the full list of item
						types
						along with their
						description, please use the
						GetNumericDescription
						service with the description
						type as 'ccsity'

action.description:
L - Log only - the details will only be
						logged
						for reporting purposes V - Log
						and validate - the details will be
						logged after validating that the account
						number specified is the
						same as the
						direct debit account number linked to
						the credit account
						P - Post to external
						account immediately - an attempt to
						debit the
						external account is done on
						the spot regardless if the end of day
						processing is running or the item is not
						posted in Cortex. U - Post
						to external
						account immediately and updated the
						blocked amount in
						Cortex. A - Post to
						external account only when the item in
						Cortex is
						posted.

						main address or other logging purpose address.

firstName.description: First name of the contact person

middleName.description: Middle name of the contact person

lastName.description: Last name of the contact person

professionTitle.description: Professional title of the contact person

phoneExtension.description: Phone 1 extension of the contact person

mobile.description: Mobile number of the contact person

email.description: email address of the contact person

role.description:
Specifies the role of the contact as an entity
						might have multiple contacts

allowLoading.description:
Specifies if loading is allowed for cards under.
						(deprecated,
						the account risk is the new module using for
						restricting the laod)
						this entity

loadingCycle.description:
Number of days constituting a loading cycle for
						which a maximum amount and count of account load are allowed.
						Any 0
						or negative value means no cycle is required and the maximum
						loading amount and count defined will be always used (deprecated,
						the account risk is the new module using for restricting the laod)

allOf.description:
Maximum amount allowed to be loaded to an
						account
						in a loading cycle. Any 0 or negative value means no limit
						is
						required. (deprecated,
						the account risk is the new module using
						for
						restricting the laod)

maximumLoadingCount.description:
Maximum number of load operations allowed to be
						for the account in a loading cycle. Any 0 or negative value means
						no limit is required. (deprecated,
						the account risk is the new
						module
						using for
						restricting the laod)

allowLoadFromDifferentEntity.description:
Specifies if loading the card from a different
						entity (other than the parent) is allowed

allowUnload.description:
Specifies if unload (closing the account and
						retreiving the balance) is allowed for accounts under this entity

allowStatementGeneration.description:
Specifies if statement generation is allowed for
						accounts under this entity

defaultAccountType.description:
Default account type to be used for accounts
						created under this entity. To get the list of supported account
						types, use the GetAccountTypeList service

applyFeeAfter.description:
Number of days after which an entity fee should
						be applied (fee on the entity and not on the cardholder). 0 means
						it should be applied on the same date -1 means last day of the
						week,
						-2 means last day of the month. Any positive value means the
						fee should be applied after the specified number of days

cardValidityPeriod.description:
Specifies the validity period in months to use
						for deriving the card expiry date for a card under this entity. If
						set to -1, the validity of the card product will be used instead

allowSupplementary.description:
Specifies if supplementary cards are allowed to
						be created for cards under this entity

defaultCardStatus.description:
Default card status to use for newly created
						cards under this entity. To get the list of supported card
						statuses, use the GetCardStatusList service

defaultAccountStatus.description:
Default account status to use for newly created
						accounts under this entity. To get the list of supported account
						statuses, use the GetAccountStatusList service

bureauCheckRequired.description:
Specifies if bureau check should be done for
						cards being created under this entity. The actual bureau check is
						bank dependent and the company they have a contract with

documentGracePeriod.description:
Grace period given to the customer to provide
						all
						required documentation before canceleing the account and card.
						The
						value -1 means no restriction

allowReIssuance.description:
Specifies if re-issuance for cards under this
						entity (replacing a lost or stolen card, new card number
						generated) is allowed

allowReplacement.description:
Specifies if replacement for cards under this
						entity (replacing a damaged card, same card number is used) is
						allowed

allowRenewal.description:
Specifies if renewal is allowed for cards under
						this entity. in case set to false, cards under this entity will
						never be renewed

allowPinMailer.description:
Specifies if pin mailer generation for cards
						under this entity is allowed

minimumReIssuanceValidity.description:
Used to control the expiry date generation for
						cards being re-issued (new card number). This is the minimum
						validity a card being
						re-issued should have so that the new card
						has the same expiry
						date as the previous one. If the card has a
						validity less than this one, a new expiry date will be calculated
						based on the validity date configured

minimumReplacementValidity.description:
Used to control the expiry date generation for
						cards being replaced (same card number). This is the minimum
						validity a card being
						replaced should have so that the new card
						has
						the same expiry
						date as the previous one. If the card has a
						validity less than this one, a new expiry date will be calculated
						based on the validity date configured

renewalPostExpiryDays.description:
Number of days after the card is already expired
						it will still be considered for renewal. This is mainly used to
						re-consider cards for renewal in case it was skipped due to an
						invalid account status for example at that time

renewalPreExpiryDays.description:
Number of days before the card expires
						after
						which
						the card will considered for renewal.

earlyRenewalDays.description:
Number of days before the card expires
						after
						which
						the card can be forcedly (early) renewed

allOf.description:
Credit account to update the cash limit for.

							required in case the card is specified. If both card and
							account
							are specified, a check is done to make sure they are
							linked. If
							only card specified, the default account of the card is
							used

Credit card to update the cash limit of its
							default account. Not required in case the account is specified.
							If
							both card and account are specified, a check is done to make
							sure
							both are linked

							be

							percentage is not specified

							not
							specified

Specifies if the check on the current usage
							should be skipped. If set to false and the current usage of the
							account becomes more than the allowed limit, the request will be
							rejected. If not specified, defaulted to false

updateCmsLimitsInstantly.description:
Specifies if the effective CMS limits should be
							updated immediately. If set to false, the limits will be updated
							at EOD. If not specified, defaulted to true

Customer specific user data. Used for custom

Percentage of the credit limit allowed to be
						used
						for cash transactions. If not specified, it means there is no
						restriction on cash transactions.

creditLimit.description: Credit Limit assigned for the account.

balance.description:
Current balance used by the account. This
						balance
						DOES NOT include any pending authorization amount (or
						blocked
						amount)

totalAmountUsed.description:
Current balance used by the account including
						the
						authorized/blocked amount

currentCycleBalance.description:
Balance used in the current cycle. This balance
						is updated as payments are made

previousCycleBalance.description:
Balance used in the previous cycle. This balance
						is updated as payments are made

oldCyclesBalance.description:
Balances used in old cycles (2 cycles and
						above).
						This balance is updated as payments are made

statementBalance.description:
Balance used in the previous and old cycles
						(effectively the previous cycle balance + old cycle balance)

OTB.description:
Open to buy for the account. This is mainly
						calculated using the formula (credit limit) - (balance) +
						(surplus). The amount does not take into consideration the
						authorization
						amount

effectiveOTB.description:
Effective open to buy for the account including
						the authorization/blocked amount. This is mainly calculated using
						the formula (credit limit) - (balance) + (surplus) - (authorized
						amount)

surplus.description:
Surplus amount - amount paid above the credit
						limit. This amount DOES NOT include any pending authorization
						amount (or blocked amount). Any debit on the account will use the
						amount from the surplus if available otherwise the balance is
						updated

effectiveSurplus.description:
Effective surplus amount excluding the
						authorization amount in case any

payments.description:
Amount of payments done so far in the current
						cycle

delinquencyLevel.description:
Delinquency level of the account which
						identifies
						if the account has any pending payments. The delinquency
						calculation is implementation specific as there are multiple
						methods available (configured by charge profile). Cortex supports
						up to delinquency level 6

minimumPayment.description:
Minimum payment requested from the customer for
						the current cycle. This field is for information only. Even if the
						customer does a payment, it is not updated. The DueBalance field
						will hold the remaining due balance on the account for the current
						cycle

previousBalance.description:
Balance of the account at the end of the
						previous
						cycle. This field is for information purpose and is not
						updated
						until the next cycle

previousMinimumPayment.description:
Minimum payment requested from the customer for
						the previous cycle. This field is for information purpose only.

previousSurplus.description:
Surplus of the account at the end of the
						previous
						cycle. For information purposes only

consecutiveLatePayments.description:
Number of consecutive late payments on the
						accounts (consecutive number of cycles where the due amount was
						not paid)

cycleCode.description:
Code identifying the cycle the account belongs
						to

cyclePhase.description:
Indicates in which phase the account is
						currently
						in. Also can indicate if the account is canceled or in
						collection.
						To get the full list of allowed values, use the
						GetNumericDescription service with tag 'ccscyc'. Main supported
						values are the following:
						- -1: Account No Yet Activated
						- 0: None
						-
						1: After Cycle End, Before Pay By Date (due date)
						- 2: After Pay By
						Date (due date)
						- 3: After End of Cycle
						- 100: Pre-Collection - to
						be moved to collection on next end of cycle
						- 101: In collection
						-
						102: Pre-canceled - to be moved to canceled on next end of cycle
						-
						103: Account canceled (Statements will no longer be generated and
						no processing done on the account)

lastCashMovementDate.description:
Last date there was a cash movement (any cash
						operation - payment or usage) on the account

debits.description: Total amount of debits done during this cycle

credits.description: Total amount of credits done during this cycle

dueBalance.description:
Balance due for this cycle. This is the actual
						amount due to be paid by the customer before the due date. This
						amount actually changes when a payment is done

notDueBalance.description:
Total not due balance of the account. In case a
						payment is done and the account doesn't have a due balance, this

lastPaymentDate.description:
Date the last payment was received on. Not
						available if the account does not have any payment done yet

External account details - can be used when
						external transfer is required or additional external account
						details are needed for logging purposes

action.description:
L - Log only - the details will only be
						logged
						for reporting purposes V - Log
						and validate - the details will be
						logged after validating that the account
						number specified is the
						same as the
						direct debit account number linked to
						the credit account
						P - Post to external
						account immediately - an attempt to
						debit the
						external account is done on
						the spot regardless if the end of day
						processing is running or the item is not
						posted in Cortex. U - Post
						to external
						account immediately and updated the
						blocked amount in
						Cortex. A - Post to
						external account only when the item in
						Cortex is
						posted.

Source code identifying the source of creation
						of the payment plan

						Value Description

						0 Default
						1 Online
						2 CCS
						Financial
						3 TLOG authorization
						4 TLOG financial
						5 Input File
						6 Plan
						Program
						7 Web-services authorization
						8 Web-services financial
						98
						Account re-scheduling
						99 Account re-scheduling
